caseTitle: Muhammad Rafiq v. The State thr. Director General, Regional NAB, Quetta
tagline: The Chairman, National Accountability Bureau (NAB) has the legal authority to delegate his power to file a reference under Section 18(g) read with Section 34 A of the National Accountability Ordinance, 1999 (Ordinance). The principles of principal and agent arising out of contractual delegation could not apply to the delegated authority of the delegator and the delegate, which derived its source from an enactment, being statutory delegation. The authority of the Chairman, NAB to file a reference and to sanction the filing of an appeal against the decision of the Accountability Court are two distinct functions and have thus been accordingly dealt with separately in the Ordinance.
